actions.committee: Senate Committee on Rules and Administration
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Rules and Administration.

official_title: A bill entitled "The Congressional Ethics Act of 1977."

summary.text: Requires each Member of Congress, each employee of Congress, and each candidate for Congress to file annually with the Comptroller General a complete financial report including the amount and source of each item of income, reimbursement, and gift exceeding $100, the value of each asset and liability in excess of $5,000, information on business transactions exceeding $5,000, and the amount of taxes paid for the most recent tax year. Sets forth civil and criminal penalties for violation of this Act.

titles.title: A bill entitled "The Congressional Ethics Act of 1977."
